Who is Solomon?



To support my psychology degree, I taught young children how to code with OpenWorld Learning (OWL). For everyone involved with OWL, it was an incredible experience. During OWL's 20 year tenure, disadvantaged children in Denver, Colorado were able to discover their independence, have fun, and build skills with the Microworlds Curriculumn.

In those 3 years, my students inspired me and some of my co-workers to become programmers. To advance through Microworlds, each child had to combine their creativity, logic, and emotional well-being. And, most times, the process seemed so rewarding. Shortly before OWL ceased operations, I took a chance on myself and tried a new life path.

This decision would yield a 2 year journey of self-study, ~730 cups of tea, life-changing mentorship, new coding friends, and a fresh perspective. Today, I write clean code, have become a persistent problem-solver, and continue to learn more about people and their needs. After work hours, you can find me staying active, singing with Voices of Reason, practicing commercial voiceover, illustrating, and writing short stories.
